titleStmt.title: [Letter], 1857 Nov. 18, Executive Department, Tahlequah [to] Colo[nel] George Butler, U[nited] S[tates] Agent / John Ross : a machine-readable transcription
titleStmt.author: Cherokee Nation. Principal Chief (1828-1866 : Ross)

availability.p: This work is the property of The Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text.

bibl.title: [Letter], 1857 Nov. 18, Executive Department, Tahlequah [to] Colo[nel] George Butler, U[nited] S[tates] Agent / John Ross
bibl.author: Cherokee Nation. Principal Chief (1828-1866 : Ross)
bibl.note: (Copy ?) of a letter dated November 18, 1857 from John Ross, Principal Chief of the Cherokee Nation, to Colonel George Butler calling on Butler to remove intruders from the "Neutral Land" per an act of the National Council. A copy of the act, originally enclosed, is no longer attached. A note on the back indicates that this letter is a copy, but Ross's signature appears to be in his own hand.
The Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN

projectDesc.p: Prepared for The University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with Microsoft Word spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points

opener.salute:
Colo. Colonel George Butler U.S. Agent
Sir,,

div.p: In compliance with the requirements of the enclosed Copy of an Act of the National Council; It has you will perceive that it has become my duty again, "to call upon you, as, the Agent of the United States, for the immediate removal of the intruders upon the Neutral Lands"
div.closer:
I am Sir, Very respectfully Your Obt. Servt. Obedient Servant
John Ross
Prinl. Principal Chief Cherokee Nation

div.p:
Copy of a Note to
Colo. Geo. Colonel George Butler U.S. Agent respecting the intruders upon the Neutral Land 18th Nov. 1857
